radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse cerebral volume loss with ventricular prominence and periventricular hypodensity, an old lacunar infarct in the left caudate head, and atherosclerotic calcification of the major intracranial vessels.
Hyperintensity of the white matter and small lacunar infarcts in the right side of the thalamus, right pons, and left caudate, with normal results on magnetic resonance angiography.

radiographic_examinations.date: During first admission (exact date not specified)
radiographic_examinations.findings: Parenchymal tissue loss with widening of sulci and ventricles, multifocal signal abnormalities in the white matter, multifocal areas of reduced diffusion involving the basal ganglia and the cortical mantle.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: During the first month, MRI showed reduced diffusion in frontal, right parietal, and temporal cortexes and in the right caudate nucleus, indicating progression.
